title: My phone's WLAN connection automatically disconnects after the screen times out. What can I do?
answer:
This problem is caused by the sleep policy. On the home screen, touch Settings > Wi-Fi. Touch the menu key and touch Advanced Wi-Fi > Keep Wi-Fi on during sleep > Always. 

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110590) ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110591)

 ![](http://consumer.huawei.com/support/servlet/imageServlet?dlType=HtmlAreaImage&imageId=110592)

 By default, Always is selected. If you change the sleep policy, Wi-Fi disconnects when the screen times out. The implication of each option is given as below: 

 Always: The WLAN connection is always kept. 

 Only when plugged in: The WLAN connection is kept only when the phone is charged. WLAN disconnects in 3 minutes after the screen times out if the phone is not charged. 

 Never (increases data usage): WLAN disconnects in 3 minutes after the screen times out.
